column16: The url provided off guidance to reviewers ultimately takes you to the versions history. The first two versions int he table the links are circular and return you to the page from which you accessed the table. It is unclear as to what version is intended for review.  http://www.hl7.org/fhir/uv/sdc/history.cfml  is the intent to use the current published version R4? This might be a better URL http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep/questionnaire.html   also given the use of Questionnaire Response statements perhaps FHIR 4.0 Questionnaire Response url should be used.  https://www.hl7.org/fhir/questionnaireresponse.html
column17: What version of Structured Data Capture FHIR IG is being referenced?

column16: Does this also include patient direct entry / response to questionnaires or must the information be validated prior to inclusion? (This is more a functional Implementation question, is there any guidance since PRO was cited?).
column17: Is patient direct data entry a component of the data collection workflow?

column16: Reviewing the data elements and searching against FHIR resources there is a substancial gap in existing resources by which can we assume many of these must be coverd by forms/questionnaires?  There are identified data elements, will specific questionnaires be created and standardized for specific categories of information?
column17: Will Specific questionnaires be created to support data collection?

column16: This page reinforces a concern over additional provider burden also confirmed by the data elements accessible from the WHT CRN Overview page. It will be an implementation challenge to collect the variety of information needed. Questionnaires are likely the best tools, the risk of increased clinician  burden should be discussed within the context of implementation within this IG. Input on strategies and mapping to existing documentation and charting workflows should be covered. The ability to map the data elements  to existing workfow and to questionnaires will be critical to reducing provider burden and increasing data collection compliance.
column17: Identify and  discuss limiting increase in provider burden increased by supporting data collection

column16: I see no discussion on depersonalization of patient data Is the data to retain its PI? If depersonalization is a requirement is that outside the scope of this IG and the responsibility of the registry or consumers through the portal?
column17: Does patient data depersonalization a factor?

column16: All References to the GUDID database need to be clarified to be AccessGUDID (API or Current AccessGUDID Database Download) managed by National Library of Medicine at: https://accessgudid.nlm.nih.gov/

Additional Profile specific implementation guidance:
Additional Text: The device-crn profile is intended to be used for reporting the use or implant of a medical device when the following information is available in the source system: 
1.	The unique device identifier (UDI) as a human readable string or AIDC (base64).  The UDI shall be parsed into the device identifier and the individual production identifiers if they are specified in the UDI (lotNumber, serialNumber, manufactureDate, expirationDate or distinct identifiers by using the AccessGUDID Parse UDI API.  Once the deviceIdentifier is parsed, the value will be referenced in deviceDefinition-crn along with calling the AsscessGUDID DeviceLookup and SNOMED APIs to include the manufacturer, deviceName, modelNumber and type.
2.	See deviceDefinition-crn if the UDI is not available.
column17: Add additional text as proposed in ballot comment

column16:
Additional Profile specific implementation guidance:
Remove text (Replaced by proposed text): When the deviceIdentifier (UDI-DI) is available, the DeviceDefinition data elements manufacturer, deviceName, modelNumber and type should be populated when found in the GUDID database using the deviceIdentifier.

Replacement text: 

The deviceDefinition-crn profile is intended to be used for reporting the use or implant of a medical devices when the following information is available in the source system*: 
1.	the device identifier (parsed from the UDI) and the DeviceDefinition data elements manufacturer, deviceName, modelNumber and type populated from the AcccessGUDID.  (Note: to address any use or implant of a medical device reported with the use of a UDI)
2.	in absence of a device identifier, the medical device may be defined by the manufacturer and one or more the following elements: deviceName, modelNumber or type. (Note: to address any self-reported use or implant of a medical device)


*Note: the deviceDefinition-crn resource must be used to exchange the deviceIdentifier because the data must be submitted to receiving system without expectation that it needs to do any lookups or parsing – i.e., all data elements will be supplied by the sending system in the exchange.
column17: Add/Remove text as propsed in ballot comment

column16:
Additional Profile specific implementation guidance:
…..
The Parse UDI API allows users to pass a UDI and return each part of the UDI in a structured format (specifically the serialNumber, lotNumber, expirationDate, distinctIdentifier (returned as donation_id from the Parse UDI API) or manufactureDate).
column17: Add to parenthetial statement and correct element name for manufactureDate
